questions.question: 1. In the Builder pattern, what is the purpose of the Builder class?

answers.a: a.To provide an interface for creating objects in a superclass
answers.b: b.To build the final object step by step
answers.c: c.To ensure that there is only one instance of an object created at any point
answers.d: d.To allow subclasses to alter the type of objects that will be created

questions.question: 2. Suppose you are working on a project that requires a class to represent a configuration manager, which is responsible for reading and writing configuration data used by the application. You need to ensure that only one instance of the configuration manager can exist at any given time.        Which of the following statements about using the Singleton design pattern to implement the configuration manager class is true?

answers.a: a.The configuration manager class should have a private constructor, a private static instance variable, and a public static method that returns the single instance of the class.
answers.b: b.The configuration manager class should have a public constructor, a private static instance variable, and a public static method that returns the single instance of the class.
answers.c: c.The configuration manager class should have a public constructor, a public instance variable, and a public static method that returns the single instance of the class.
answers.d: d.The configuration manager class should not use the Singleton design pattern, as it is not suitable for this scenario.

questions.question: 3. Which design pattern is being used to create the Customer and OfficeExecutive classes based on the attributes provided by the PersonFactory?

4. In a graphics editor, you have different shapes (like circles, squares, etc.) and wish to apply different effects (such as color or shadow) on top of these shapes dynamically. Which design pattern is best suited here?

5. You have implemented the Iterator pattern for your BookShelf class, creating a BookShelfIterator. Now, you realize that for certain functionalities, you need to traverse the books in reverse order, and also be able to add or remove books during iteration. Which type of Iterator would be most suitable to extend or implement to support these additional functionalities (bidirectional traversal and modification during iteration)?
